November 1, 1968
Mr. Robert Carlisle
Corporation for Public Broadcasting
545 ^Madison Avenue
New York, New York
Dear Bobs
I’ve had an opportunity to audition the WGBH Radio
Drama project material. You’ll recall we discussed
this when we were examining radio projects during
our meeting in Mr. Swezey’s office.
My position is essentially unchanged. Radio drama
program fare is virtually non-existent and would be
utilized by many stations if available. Assuming
the Corporation funds as many as five projects, I
would urge the inclusion of the WGBH project now
underway.
It’s my judgment that the other projects we discussed
should remain in the tentative priorities we gave them
previously.
You’ll recall we discussed the costs of relocating
the NER Network facility from Urbana, Illinois to
Washington, D. C. I do not yet have final figures
but it appears that the actual moving costs are not
prohibitive. When I have gathered all costs, I’ll
send the Information to you as you requested.
Sorry you didn’t attend the CPB-Ford Foundation ses¬
sion on educational radio. Stimulating — and, I
trust — helpful to those making the decisions.
Sincerely,
Robert A. Mott
RAM; Ikl
